definition: sugar-coated bullets, term used by Mao (originally in 1949) to refer to corrupting bourgeois influences (abbr. for 糖衣炮彈|糖衣炮弹[tang2 yi1 pao4 dan4])
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
sugar-coated bullets, term used by Mao (originally in 1949) to refer to corrupting bourgeois influences
(lit.) to fire blank shots/(fig.) to be all talk and no action/to shoot one's mouth off/to make empty promises
attack by a hidden enemy/a stab in the back
evil elements who have escaped eradication
(idiom) don't say you haven't been forewarned (threat used by the PRC in international diplomacy)
pinyin: wu4 wei4 yan2 zhi1 bu4 yu4

definition: the God of Thunder strikes bean curd/fig. to bully the weakest person/to pick on an easy target
